G.T.5501
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 26th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
At 3 a.m. this morning our troops attacked in the Scarpe Sector and have made progress. It is reported that we have captured MONCHY-LE-PREUX, GUEL?PPES, WANCOURT, and fighting is going on on HENIN HILL.
In the BAPAUME sector the 3rd Army have progressed east of MOIRY and have captured FAVREUIL.
North of the SOMME the 4th Army have made progress towards MERICOURT.
Our line runs:- CAPPY (exclusive), SUZANNE (exclusive), MARICOURT (exclusive), CARNOY (inclusive), MAMETZ (inclusive), BAZENTIN-LE-PETIT (exclusive), MARTINPUICH (inclusive), EUCOURT L'ABBAYE (inclusive), LE BARQUE (inclusive), AVESNES-LES-BAPAUME (exclusive), FAVREUIL (inclusive), to high ground 2,000 yards south-east of MOIRY (inclusive), MOIRY (inclusive), ST LEGER (inclusive), CROISELLES (exclusive).
Yesterday the enemy launched strong counter-attacks in the BAPAUME sector and were repulsed. North of FAVREUIL our troops met the hostile counter-attack with the bayonet and took prisoners.
French Front.
The French 1st Army have taken FRESNOY-LE-ROYE north of ROYE.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is no change in the situation.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
26th August, 1918.
Issued at 12.50 p.m.
